intro: Aporosa inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal aporosa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
